definition: sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas

sentences.english: He climbed into the watchtower, but there was no sail.
sentences.chinese: 他爬上瞭望塔，却看不到船帆。

sentences.english: Then I cast all the appendages and the sail.
sentences.chinese: 那么，我投的所有附件和船帆。

sentences.english: You can repair the torn sails and restock the ship and supply fresh navigation charts.
sentences.chinese: 你能修复撕裂的船帆，重新装船和准备新的导航图。

sentences.english: He started up the shore with the mast furled sail of his boat.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着桅竿和卷起的船帆，往岸上爬去。

sentences.english: The boat scudded along before the rising wind.
sentences.chinese: 升起了船帆，以使船顺风向航行。

sentences.english: A spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 从船尾桅杆伸出支撑船头四方形的船帆的圆材。

sentences.english: The sails are adjusted to create a smooth laminar flow over the sail surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 船帆的调整，以建立一个平滑层流的帆面。

sentences.english: This boat is brand new and the wind plumps up the sails.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船崭新崭新的，船帆迎风鼓起。

sentences.english: The big sail won't stay in position unless you trice it up.
sentences.chinese: 除非你挂起船帆并用绳缚住，否则它就不能稳住。

sentences.english: The sails are made by attaching the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 这些船帆是通过绑上叶子做成的。

sentences.english: Tadao Andos proposal for the Maritime Museum is shaped likeasail.
sentences.chinese: 安藤忠雄设计的形状类似船帆的海事博物馆。

sentences.english: The lower aft corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 从船尾桅杆伸出支撑船头四方形的船帆的圆材。

sentences.english: The sails swelled in the strong wind.
This week the code governing dismasting and sail damage went in.
sentences.chinese: 本周在编写关于折断船上的桅杆以及破坏船帆程序。

sentences.english: The wind bellied out the sail.
The sailors provided against the coming storm by furling all sails .
sentences.chinese: 水手们收起全部船帆，以防备即将来临的暴风雨。

definition: the bow or prow of a ship
